result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Thomas Delap was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
15CM408 & 15TR5470: Defendant Steven Thomas Delap in court, in custody w/o counsel; James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State heard - Def. plead at last hearing, will request that 15TR5470 be dismissed; Def. has not yet been sentenced in another county (most likely prison); State heard on recomm. (outstanding cases in Walworth Co. and Jefferson Co.); Def. heard (Jefferson Co. vacated and to be resentenced, Def. wants credit from 9/6/15); Court imposes sentence; Court notes 15TR5470 is dismissed; Def. remanded

* 45 days in DCJ w/45 days credit concurrent each count
- $243 CC within 60 days
- $200 DNA surcharge and sample
Sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

(15CM407 & 408, 15TR5470) Defendant Steven Thomas Delap in court, in custody w/o counsel; James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. heard - wants the trial taken off and set it for P&S in April; Def. wants to do more research on sentence credit; State heard - wants Def. to plead today and put off sentencing; Court denied prior suppression motion; discussion on Def.'s brief; State heard on plea agreement; Court reviews charges/penalties in 15CM408; Def. pleads NC to charges in 15CM408; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Obstructing/Rep. and Poss. of DP/Rep. in 15CM408 w/15CM407 D&RI; Sent. set; Def. is being revoked and to be sentenced in April; Def. remanded
from defendant/CDs on Brief (CDs in file in exhibit room)
CDs and cover letter from defendant rec'd and sent up
Cover Letter with Dispatch Recording (kept in exhibit drawer)
denying motion to supress illegal arrest
Letter from DA with Dispatch Recording CD rec'd and sent up

Return date at 03-07-2016 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 03-30-2016 08:15 am.

Cases called 15CM407, 15CM408, 15TR5470.  Defendant Steven Thomas Delap in court, in custody.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Corey appears for Dodge County on case 15TR5470.  Atty. Corey is heard on motion to reopen.  Mr. DeLap is heard.    Court will reopen case 15TR5470.  Case will transfer to DA's office and track with criminal matters.  Atty. Sempf is heard.  Mr. Delap is heard on motion to supress on case 15CM408.  Court heard will allow to proceed.  Michael Willmann, called, S/T.  Mr. DeLap is heard.  Court is heard, there was a legitimate arrest warrant, probable cause that he lived there.  Mr. DeLap continues to be heard.  Atty. Sempf argues.  Mr. DeLap continues to argue.  Steven DeLap S/T.  Michael Willmann retakes the stand, still under oath.  Mr. DeLap heard.  Arguments continues.  Court is heard, will read the cases that were provided, Mr. DeLap also provides his written argument for Court to review.  Court will issue written decision.  Mr. DeLap would like the 911 disc submitted.  Atty. Sempf is heard.  Atty. Sempf will provide the 911 disc.  Dustin Waas called, S/T.  Court finds that there is probable cause for obstructing, warrant issue/fresh pursuit issue Court issue written decision.  Atty. Sempf has two weeks to submit brief, Mr. DeLap 2 weeks to respond.  Jury trial scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Return date scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

of Intent to present testimony by videoconferencing

15CM407 & 408: Defendant Steven Thomas Delap in court, in custody.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. has not rec'd discovery request, told he needs to pay for same; Def. is doing pro se; Court reviews right to counsel; Def. is on PO hold and is being revoked; Def. does not want an SPD; Court finds Def. V&F waives right to counsel and will allow to proceed pro se on both cases; State heard on discovery request; Def. sworn, Def. possible revocation that could send him to prison; Def. has no money; Court finds Def. indigent and orders DA to turn over discovery request; Def. makes oral motion to suppress evidence in 408 case; Court notes that Def. should write something up on same and submit; JT remains; bond cont.; Def. remanded

w/15CM407: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.

(10:36) 15CM407 & 408: Defendant Steven Thomas Delap in custody via video from Jefferson County Jail with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (will appoint).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. now states that he is waiving representation and will proceed pro se; Atty. Moeller leaves; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. on PO hold (absconded); State heard on bond, high cash each case; Def. response, objects; Court finds probable cause. RD 11/16/15 at 3:30pm & JT 12/22/15 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets $5,000.00 PA Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.
